pages.text: To start delving into Spectrum you first have to find some gemstone shards.$(br2)Each kind of gemstone represents an elemental color and a different kind of natural force.

pages.title: Topaz Shards
pages.text: Topaz Shards lie surprisingly heavy in your hand. This gemstone quickly turned out to be one of the most robust materials you've ever gotten your hands on - perhaps only surpassed by diamond. Topaz is found in geodes at the very top of steep hills and on the tops of sky-high mountains.$(br)The Topaz represents $(bold)$(c_cyan)MATTER.$()

pages.title: Amethyst Shards
pages.text: Magenta light refracts in this gemstone.$(br)Formed over eons in the geodes, this gemstone radiates awe. It is a symbol of permanence and found in the deepest layers of the world.$(br2)The Amethyst represents $(bold)$(c_purple)TIME$().

pages.title: Citrine Shards
pages.text: This yellow gemstone is found close to surface level where the suns light dissipates into warmth.$(br2)Its bright yellow luster radiates pure $(bold)$(c_yellow)ENERGY$() and makes it slightly warm to the touch at all times.

pages.title: Onyx Shards
pages.text: Onyx is nearly pitch black. It almost seems as if it drains the light from its surroundings.$(br2)The Onyx, as a combination of energy, matter, and time, serves as a reinforcing focus and $(bold)$(c_black)CATALYST$() for magical tools and devices.

pages.title: Moonstone Shards
pages.text: Its bluish-white shimmer reminds you of the soothing light of the moon on a calm summer night. The tranquility it exudes leaves a calming, yet significant impression, like a sleeping cat - balm for the soul and yet a predator, always on guard.$(br2)The Moonstone embodies pure $(bold)$(c_white)MAGIC$().
